title: Welcome to MSD
summary: Welcome to the Mission Support Directorate (MSD).   Have you ever wondered how NASA manages to achieve all the incredible missions it does, like probing the Sun and studying the history of our Universe? We do it through teamwork, one of our core values. And an essential part of NASA’s team is what we call […]

title: Industry eyes continuous satellite production to keep pace with demand
summary:
The U.S. space industry is several years away from having the capacity for continuous satellite production, according to prime contractors speaking April 8 during a Space Symposium panel in Colorado Springs.
The post Industry eyes continuous satellite production to keep pace with demand appeared first on SpaceNews.

title: Sixty Years in Canberra: NASA’s Deep Space Network
summary: Deep Space Station 43 (DSS-43), a 230-foot-wide (70-meter-wide) radio antenna at NASA’s Deep Space Network facility in Canberra, Australia, is seen in this March 4, 2020, image. DSS-43 was more than six times as sensitive as the original antenna at the Canberra complex, so it could communicate with spacecraft at greater distances from Earth. In […]

title: U.S. Space Command chief calls for new capabilities for combat while emphasizing deterrence
summary:
Gen. Stephen Whiting said the Pentagon is actively pursuing cutting-edge technologies and establishing requirements for new capabilities to counter China in space

title: Findings from the Field: A Research Symposium for Student Scientists
summary: Within the scientific community, peer review has become the process norm for which an author’s research or ideas undergo careful examination by other experts in their field. It encourages each scientist to meet the high standards that they themselves, as writers and reviewers, have aided in setting. It has become essential to the academic writing […]

title: NASA’s First Flight With Crew Important Step on Long-term Return to the Moon, Missions to Mars
summary: The Artemis II test flight will be NASA’s first mission with crew under Artemis. Astronauts on their first flight aboard NASA’s Orion spacecraft will confirm all of the spacecraft’s systems operate as designed with crew aboard in the actual environment of deep space.  Through the Artemis campaign, NASA will send astronauts to explore the Moon […]

title: NASA’s Deep Space Network Starts New Dish, Marks 60 Years in Australia
summary: Canberra joined the global network in 1965 and operates four radio antennas. Now, preparations have begun on its fifth as NASA works to increase the network’s capacity. NASA’s Deep Space Network facility in Canberra, Australia celebrated its 60th anniversary on March 19 while also breaking ground on a new radio antenna. The pair of achievements […]

title: NASA Astronaut to Answer Questions from Students in Florida
summary: Students from Dade City, Florida, will have the chance to connect with NASA astronaut Nichole Ayers as she answers prerecorded science, technology, engineering, and mathematics-related questions from aboard the International Space Station. title: Eclipses, Science, NASA Firsts: Heliophysics Big Year Highlights
summary: One year ago today, a total solar eclipse swept across the United States. The event was a cornerstone moment in the Heliophysics Big Year, a global celebration of the Sun’s influence on Earth and the entire solar system.
